title: Male fertility & sexual health
subtitle: Evidence-based overview of evaluation, nutrients, and practical 8–12 week protocol
disclaimer: Wellness guidance only; ED or fertility concerns warrant clinical evaluation.

sections.title: Clinical evaluation (first steps)
points: Assess both partners in parallel and complete a full history and physical exam.
Order semen analysis and basic endocrine/metabolic labs when indicated.
Male infertility can signal broader health issues, so optimize overall health.

items.name: Zinc
items.role: Supports spermatogenesis and testosterone; avoid chronic >40 mg/day

items.name: Selenium
items.role: Seminal antioxidant supporting motility; UL 400 mcg/day

items.name: Folate (B9)
items.role: DNA synthesis in spermatogenesis; often paired with zinc

items.name: Vitamin D
items.role: Hormone regulation and sperm motility; aim ≥30 ng/mL

items.name: L-Carnitine
items.role: Sperm energy metabolism; studies use 3–6 months

items.name: CoQ10
items.role: Mitochondrial energy and sperm antioxidant support

items.name: Omega-3 (EPA/DHA)
items.role: Sperm membrane integrity and vascular health

items.name: Ashwagandha
items.notes: Promising sperm/testosterone data; rare liver injury reports; discontinue once pregnancy occurs

items.name: Tongkat Ali
items.notes: May increase testosterone in some men; avoid excess dosing

items.name: PDE5 inhibitors
items.notes: First-line ED therapy; contraindicated with nitrates

items.name: Semen analysis
items.targets: Volume ≥1.4 mL; count ≥39M; total motility ≥42%; morphology ≥4%

items.name: Hormones
items.targets: Total testosterone ~300–1000 ng/dL; LH 1.4–15; FSH 1.5–12; prolactin <20 ng/mL

items.name: Metabolic
items.targets: HbA1c <5.7% if tested; assess lipids and glucose with risk factors

steps: Mediterranean-style diet with lean protein, plants, and omega-3s
Avoid smoking/vaping; limit alcohol; manage stress and sleep
Targeted supplements based on labs (zinc, selenium, folate, vitamin D, omega-3)
Add carnitine or CoQ10 if motility is low
Recheck semen analysis and key labs after ~12 weeks

semenVolume: Semen volume is influenced more by hydration and abstinence interval than supplements.
Consider 2–3 days abstinence for peak volume if needed.
refractoryPeriod: Improves with sleep, stress reduction, fitness, and reduced alcohol.
Pharmacologic prolactin modulation is not DIY and requires a clinician.

redFlags: New or persistent ED with cardiovascular risk factors
Very low semen volume or dry orgasm
